UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cholesterol-conjugated stapled peptides inhibit Ebola and Marburg viruses in vitro and in vivo.
Literature.Author: Pessi A, Bixler SL, Soloveva V, Radoshitzky S, Retterer C, Kenny T, Zamani R, Gomba G, Gharabeih D, Wells JM, Wetzel KS, Warren TK, Donnelly G, Van Tongeren SA, Steffens J, Duplantier AJ, Kane CD, Vicat P, Couturier V, Kester KE, Shiver J, Carter K, Bavari S

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human embryonic kidney HEK293T cells:50% Cytotoxicity=>=25 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Ebola virus EBOV(IC50 I=5.44±0.85µM),Ebola virus EBOV(IC90 I=25.75µM),Marburg virus MARV(IC50 I=9.80±0.94µM),Marburg virus MARV(IC90 I=17.59µM),Sudan virus SUDV(IC50 I=1.31±0.30µM),Sudan virus SUDV(IC90 I=4.49µM),Chikungunya virus (CHIKV)(IC50 I=22.92±2.62µM),Human cervical carcinoma HeLa(50-60% Cytotoxicity=>30µM),Human osteosarcoma U2OS(50-60% Cytotoxicity=>30µM),Ebola virus EBOV-GP PsV(IC50 E=1.82±0.55µM),Ebola virus EBOV-GP PsV(IC90=29.46µM),Marburg virus MARV-GP PsV(IC50 E=3.99±0.87µM),Marburg virus MARV-GP PsV(IC90=19.84µM)
